[root@localhost ~]# yum install stratis-cli
Updating Subscription Management repositories.
Error: There are no enabled repositories in "/etc/yum.repos.d", "/etc/yum/repos.d", "/etc/distro.repos.d".

https://access.redhat.com/discussions/3066851

[root@localhost ~]# cd /etc/yum.repos.d
[root@localhost yum.repos.d]# ls
redhat.repo
[root@localhost yum.repos.d]# cd /etc/yum/repos.d
bash: cd: /etc/yum/repos.d: No such file or directory
[root@localhost yum.repos.d]# cd /etc/distro.repos.d
bash: cd: /etc/distro.repos.d: No such file or directory

[root@localhost yum.repos.d]# subscription-manager status
+-------------------------------------------+
   System Status Details
+-------------------------------------------+
Overall Status: Invalid

Red Hat Enterprise Linux for x86_64 Beta:
- Not supported by a valid subscription.

System Purpose Status: Not Specified

[root@localhost yum.repos.d]# yum repolist
Updating Subscription Management repositories.

[root@localhost yum.repos.d]# sudo subscription-manager repos --enable redhat.repo
Error: 'redhat.repo' does not match a valid repository ID. Use "subscription-manager repos --list" to see valid repositories.

[root@localhost yum.repos.d]# subscription-manager repos --list
